intro: Trianthema patellitectum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange, often blooming in summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Trianthema patellitectum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
